```{r}
rm(list=ls()) #Removes all items in Environment!
if (!require("dplyr")) install.packages("dplyr")
library(dplyr) # to play with data
if (!require("utils")) install.packages("utils")
library(utils) #to dowload db


# I dowload the DB containing stockprice of companies for 2012 till 2016 (at 01/12/YYYY)

StockPrice <- read.csv2("DataBase/StockPrice/YahooSample8.csv", sep = ";", header = TRUE, stringsAsFactors = FALSE)

#I need the number of the index, so I dowload companies, create a dataframe with only ticker and index (1,...,397) and then I merge this DF with StockPrice

Companies <- read.csv2("DataBase/Companies.csv", sep = ";", header = TRUE, stringsAsFactors = FALSE)

TickerIndex <- Companies[,c("Ticker","Companies")]
StockPrice1 <- merge(StockPrice,TickerIndex, by = "Ticker")

#I restructure
StrockPrice2 <- StockPrice1[,c("Companies", "Ticker", "Year", "Close", "Volume")]


```
